cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterflies have an ecological role as a food source for various predators.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Butterfly Prey Role and Anti-predator Strategies

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The food source role of butterflies contributes to ecosystem biodiversity.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Butterfly Prey Role and Anti-predator Strategies
remarks: Could alternatively model butterfly directly contributing; here we emphasize the role.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an organism exhibits a specific ecological or functional role within an ecosystem.
args.justification: The relation links the organism (butterfly) to a description of its ecological role (being a food source for predators). A role-oriented predicate best captures this semantics.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject factor or role causally or functionally contributes to the presence, maintenance, or magnitude of the object phenomenon or state.
args.justification: The relation describes how the butterflies' food-source role functionally adds to or supports ecosystem biodiversity, matching a generic 'contributes_to' causal-impact predicate.
This relation expresses the mapping between an organism and its ecological/functional role in an ecosystem; grouping it under an ecological_role_relation class is appropriate.
The relation captures how a role impacts a higher-level ecological variable (biodiversity), fitting a broader class of ecological impact or effect relations.
Linking an organism to its ecological role is an associative/functional mapping rather than a strict causal, spatial, or compositional relation.
The description and qualifiers emphasize that the role of butterflies helps bring about or maintain biodiversity, which is inherently causal.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an organism exhibits a specific ecological or functional role within an ecosystem.
executed_decisions.justification: The relation links the organism (butterfly) to a description of its ecological role (being a food source for predators). A role-oriented predicate best captures this semantics.
